intro: Gnaphalium nubicum, commonly known as the alpine cudweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Gnaphalium nubicum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
